page.title: 03Jackfield Church
page.content: Jackfield Church was built in 1862.It stands in Salthouse Road near Craven Dunhill tileworks. The church is built of bricks made from local clays. Under an archway there is a huge door which is made of wood, there is a massive key to unlock it.On the sides of the archway are two heads carved of stone. Inside the church they are 44 benches.The floor and walls of the chancel are covered in decorative tiles which were made locally,there is a large hand painted panel of tiles above the altar.There are many stained glass windows showing pictures of bible stories. Services are held every Sunday,15 - 25 people attend. Jackfield Brass Band plays on special occasions.
